div.p: Get to know some of our teachers and staff…
The Windthorst Band is cancelled this Friday March 20. We will update these events as we are allowed to. Thank you for your past support of our band.

Windthorst ISD has been working hard to achieve Marzano Resources HRS Certifications for the last two years. Here is the different levels of certification a district can achieve. Windthorst Elementary has received their Level 2 Certification and the Windthorst Junior High & High School has received their Level 1 Certification! Great things are happening at WISD! Congratulations goes out to our staff for all their hard work achieving these certifications!

The Elementary will be open Monday, March 30 from 9:00-2:00 for parents to turn in their students work and to get the next round of assignments. We will also have report cards ready to go at this pick-up.
div.div: Stacy Schroeder also asked that if your child has library books to please bring them up here that day so we can turn them in. She would like to have as many of these turned in as possible – At this time they are unable to check out any more books.
Thank you again for working with your children during this time!! We appreciate all of you!!

div.p: For the safety of our students and the community, Windthorst ISD athletic facilities will be closed. No organized practices or games will take place on WISD property while school is closed.

div.div: Windthorst Jr High and High School is contacting every student’s parents in order to let them know we are providing educational services during this very strange time.

There will be someone at the Jr High/High School from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. on Thursday (3-19-20) and Friday (3-20-20). You may have to come to the principal’s office to find them. The HS front door will be unlocked.

There will be teachers available in both High School and Jr. High from 8 a.m. – 2 p.m. Monday (3-23-20), Tuesday (3-24-20), and Wednesday (3-25-20). If a student needs to ask a question of get some help, it would be best to contact the school at this time.
We apologize for the inconvenience and are very appreciative of your understanding. We are in completely uncharted waters and will continue to do the best we can.
Please contact me if you have any questions or concerns. (roy.longcrier@windthorstisd.net or 940-423-6680)

div.p: Windthorst High School is among the State’s most dominant programs in Volleyball. The Trojanettes participated in the UIL state final four every year since 1991 (until 2009 when the streak finally ended) and were in the Class A championship game in all but two of those years, including a 12 year stretch from 1997-2008. The school has 13 state titles in Volleyball, the most of any Class A program and tied with East Bernard for the most in any classification.
In addition, Windthorst also won the 1996 and 2003 Class A State Football championships.
The Softball Program has won two Class A State Softball Championships in 2004, 2005.
The Trojans Baseball Team won the school’s first Class A State Championship in 2010.
Windthorst FFA also has 2 State Championships in Dairy Judging.
The first was won in 1990 and the other in 2011.

Susan Veitenheimer, RN

email: susan.veitenheimer@windthorstisd.net

a.title: Link to our Health Services Department

div.p:
Syndi Humpert
Phone: 940-423-6644
email: syndi.humpert@windthorstisd.net
Learn More | Menus
Windthorst Independent School District is a public school district based in Windthorst, Texas, USA.
Located in Archer County , the district extends into a portion of Clay County.

Our goal at Windthorst Independent School District is to ensure that all students succeed at every grade level and graduate from high school fully prepared and equipped for the next level of their educational journey. Every staff member in the Windthorst Independent School District is committed to providing our students with the tools to explore and achieve their potential, to take responsibility for their own learning, and to recognize that learning is a lifelong process. We provide a stimulating, secure, and imaginative environment which fosters learning, self-esteem, and independent thinking. At Windthorst ISD, our kids genuinely come first.
The Windthorst Independent School Distrist has a proud tradition of educational achievement, receiving an “A” rating in the newly formed Accountably System in 2017-2018.

div.class: et_pb_module et_pb_testimonial et_pb_testimonial_0 clearfix et_pb_text_align_left et_pb_bg_layout_light et_pb_icon_off et_pb_testimonial_no_image

p.span: I know all of you are following the ever changing situation and responses surrounding the COVID-19 virus. I understand this is a challenging time for all of us.

Several weeks ago it seemed like a normal spring day with a busy spring schedule taking place as usual. The only difference was a virus that was affecting people in other countries and in several states away. Few weeks ago the first school in Texas shut down for what was hopefully a short amount of time. Now, the governor of Texas shut down every school district through May 3

Through all of this, Windthorst ISD is continuing to place the educational needs and safety of the students and staff at the forefront. All of our work environments have changed but our dedication to the students remains steadfast. I am very proud of our staff for their diligence in continuing to educate the students. They have been working hard to find creative ways to educate their classes as this challenge continues. Teachers have put in many hours developing online classrooms, answering emails, making phone calls and videos in order to stay in contact with students. Teachers are also making accommodations for students without access to the internet. The technology department has been available to help with the changing needs of the staff and students.

Our maintenance staff is continuing to keep our grounds and buildings well maintained. The cafeteria staff has deep cleaned and sanitized the kitchen. The business office is adapting to changing regulations and still keeping the day to day business running smoothly.

This is a first for everyone and the situation changes daily. Windthorst ISD will be back in school as soon as the safety level rises for the students, staff, and community. As I am writing this, we are scheduled to return to school on May 3rd
. However, I believe we need to be prepared for a longer period of time.

We will provide two more weeks of instruction for students. We commend the parents as they navigate through working, taking care of their families, and now additionally, adjusting to a home learning environment.
Our hope is that we will be able to continue on with UIL events, banquets and prom in some fashion. Once again, we will have to wait to make any decisions.

div.p: Superintendent, Windthorst ISD
